    • changeState

      public abstract void changeState()
      Used only in King, Rook and Piece classes. Switches isSpecialMove boolean to false after first move, to turn off Castling (King and Rook) or double move (Pawn)

    • getPossibleMoves

      public abstract boolean[][] getPossibleMoves(Chessboard chessboard, int x, int y)
      Calculates moves available to Piece in given position on given chessboard. Every Piece moves differently, so every chess piece that extends Piece class implements this method in different way
      Parameters:
      chessboard - with current game
      x - position
      y - position
      Returns:
      boolean 8x8 array with true (if Piece can move to that square) or false (if Piece can't move to that square)

    • getChessBoardWithLineOfPossibleMoves

      public boolean[][] getChessBoardWithLineOfPossibleMoves(Chessboard chessboard, boolean[][] inputChessBoardOfPossibleMoves, int posX, int posY, int vecX, int vecY)
      Adds line of possible moves to given inputChessBoardOfPossibleMoves. Used to define moves of rook, bishop and queen. Line can be either diagonal or straight, there are 8 possible directions.
      Parameters:
      chessboard - with current game
      inputChessBoardOfPossibleMoves - previously calculated possible moves
      posX - x position of Piece
      posY - y position of Piece
      vecX - direction, can be only 3 states: -1:left, 0:none, 1:right
      vecY - direction, can be only 3 states: -1:down, 0:none, 1:up
      Returns:
      returns given inputChessBoardOfPossibleMoves + new possible line of moves

    • compareTo

      public int compareTo(Piece piece)
      Specified by:
      compareTo in interface Comparable<Piece>
